intro: Telosma angustiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf telosma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by oval-shaped berries. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
